title: Travel to Taniti
shortDescription: Learn more about visiting to our tropical paradise.
details: Taniti is served by a small airport that can accommodate small jets and propeller planes.
An expansion project is underway to allow larger jets to land within the next few years.
A small cruise ship docks once a week at Yellow Leaf Bay, but most visitors arrive by air.
Flight schedules vary seasonally, so visitors are encouraged to book well in advance.
imageTitle: Small jet arriving at Taniti Airport
imageAltText: Small plane landing on tropical island runway
heroText: Getting here is half the adventure — and Taniti’s airport is ready to welcome you.

title: Getting Around Taniti
shortDescription: Exploring Taniti is easy, with a variety of ground transportation options available for visitors and locals alike.
details: Public buses serve Taniti City and operate daily from 5 a.m. to 11 p.m.
Private buses connect visitors to the rest of the island, including remote beaches and villages.
Taxis are readily available in Taniti City for quick and easy rides.
Rental cars can be obtained from a local agency near the airport — book early during peak season!
Bike rentals are available across the city; helmets are required by law for all cyclists.
Taniti City is flat and very walkable, making it easy to explore on foot.
Many tourists stay near Merriton Landing, a lively area full of shops, dining, and entertainment — all easily walkable.
imageTitle: Bicycles parked along Taniti City street
imageAltText: Row of colorful rental bikes on a tropical island sidewalk
heroText: From buses to bikes, getting around Taniti is simple, safe, and part of the island experience.

title: Frequently Asked Questions
shortDescription: Answers to the most common questions travelers have before visiting Taniti Island.
details:
What kind of power outlets are used in Taniti?

Taniti uses 120-volt outlets, the same as in the United States.

Can I buy alcohol at any time?

Alcohol cannot be sold or served between midnight and 9:00 a.m.

What is the drinking age?

The drinking age is 18, but enforcement is generally relaxed.

Is English widely spoken?

Many younger Tanitians speak fluent English. In rural areas, English is less common, especially among older residents.

Are there hospitals and clinics?

Taniti has one hospital and several clinics. The hospital staff includes many multilingual employees.

Is crime a concern?

Violent crime is very rare, but visitors should stay alert for pickpocketing and petty theft, especially in tourist areas.

Are there national holidays to be aware of?

Yes, Taniti celebrates many national holidays. During holidays, tourist attractions and restaurants may close, so plan accordingly.

What currency is used?

Taniti uses the U.S. dollar, but many businesses also accept euros and yen. Banks and businesses provide currency exchange services, and major credit cards are widely accepted.

Are credit cards accepted everywhere?

Most major credit cards are accepted, especially in Taniti City and tourist areas.

What is the best way to exchange money?

Several banks offer currency exchange services with competitive rates.

How safe is it to walk around at night?

Taniti City is generally safe, but it’s still wise to stick to well-lit areas and travel in groups when possible.
